title: What we know so far
partialText: Iran has retaliated with a missile barrage towards Israel, while explosions have been heard in Qatar, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE.

title: Inside Iran, panic as strikes hit but for some it's a moment of relief
partialText: Iranians talk about what is happening inside the country, despite an almost total internet blackout.

title: Bowen: A dangerous moment, but US and Israel see opportunity not to be missed
partialText: Israel and the US believe Iran's regime is vulnerable, dealing with an economic crisis and the aftermath of protests.

title: UK planes 'in the sky' in Middle East as part of defensive operation, PM says
partialText: Sir Keir Starmer says protections for British bases and personnel have been stepped up to their highest level.

title: Iran says it has hit US base in Bahrain, as it launches strikes across region
partialText: Huge plumes of black smoke were seen rising from an area near the headquarters of the US Navy's Fifth Fleet in Manama, Bahrain.

title: Flights cancelled as travel warnings issued after strikes on Iran
partialText: BA, Virgin Atlantic and Wizz Air are among major airlines to overhaul their schedules in light of the attacks.

title: Polanski and Farage don't agree. But they have more in common than you might think
partialText: Despite huge political differences, the Green and Reform leaders have much in common, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

title: The third man who links Andrew with Jeffrey Epstein
partialText: For nearly a decade, David Stern acted as a key conduit between Jeffrey Epstein and Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

title: Bill Clinton asked about hot tub photo and testifies he knew 'nothing' of Epstein crimes
partialText: The former president told the committee that he would never have flown on Epstein's plane if he "had any inkling of what he was doing".

title: Mahmood to press on with immigration reforms despite by-election defeat
partialText: The home secretary is to double down on plans for Danish-style restrictions on asylum seekers.

title: Formula 1's new golden age of celebrity may have just begun
partialText: As the eighth series of Netflix's hugely popular Drive To Survive is released this weekend, has Formula 1 become one big star playground?

title: Captured off guard: The art of the snatched backseat car photo
partialText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor is the latest in a long line of famous people photographed in the back of a car.

title: 'It feels like my brain is trying to be the class clown' - the reality of Tourette's
partialText: After a week of Tourette's in the spotlight, BBC News speaks to people with the condition about what it's like to live with.

title: Six things to look out for in tonight's Brit Awards ceremony
partialText: Will there be a tribute to Ozzy Osbourne? And will Taylor Swift break her losing streak?

title: Rent tops £1,000 a month in more areas - find out where
partialText: The cost of renting privately has surged in the last five years, but tenants may now see a slowdown.

title: Kaye Adams not returning to BBC Scotland radio role
partialText: The presenter was taken off air on BBC Radio Scotland last year following an internal complaint about her conduct.

title: Resident Evil Requiem's director on redefining the survival horror genre
partialText: Director Koshi Nakanishi says balancing action and horror within the game has been a huge challenge.

title: Inside the £3.25m castle bought by Celebrity Traitors winner Alan Carr
partialText: The property in the Borders is described as one of Scotland’s "most important historic houses".

title: New £20 Harry Styles tickets axed over tout fears
partialText: Ticketmaster says it has cancelled some new tickets for Harry Styles One Night Only Manchester show.

title: Man appears in court over Churchill statue damage
partialText: Caspar San Giorgio, 38, appeared at Westminster Magistrate's Court via video-link earlier.

title: These filmmakers know exactly how to get you hooked on bizarre one-minute dramas
partialText: The business depends on packing a punch right away because the first five to 10 episodes are free.

title: Donations of £15k over James Bulger's grave damage
partialText: James' mum Denise Fergus says she felt her heart break to learn of the vandalism.

title: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
partialText: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

title: First full Moon of spring set to rise in UK skies this week
partialText: How and when to see the 2026 Worm Moon in March.

title: Cruz Beckham launches music career, having fun amid family drama
partialText: Can David and Victoria's youngest son escape the "nepo baby" label and find success with his band?

title: Neil Sedaka, singer of Breaking Up Is Hard To Do, dies at 86
partialText: A skilled pianist nominated for five Grammy awards, Sedaka wrote hits through the 1950's and 60's.

title: 'I love the look on his face' - The mum who takes her baby on wilderness adventures
partialText: Experienced mountaineer Morag Skelton has taken Hamish on skiing expeditions and an island-hopping camping trip.

title: First writing may be 40,000 years earlier than thought
partialText: Scientists believe they have found evidence of written thoughts of Stone Age people on ancient objects.

title: Dog gives birth to record litter of 17 puppies
partialText: Owners of the two-year-old Irish Setter called Marigold say she has recovered well from the births.

title: Stolen spaniel found by police 160 miles from home
partialText: The brown and white spaniel, called Honey, was handed back to her "very happy" owners, police said.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Global News Podcast: US and Israel carry out joint attacks on Iran
partialText: President Trump confirms a 'major operation' underway as Tehran targets US military bases

title: By-Electioncast: Greens Win Gorton and Denton
partialText: Hannah Spencer is the new Green MP for Gorton and Denton.

title: Award-winning short thriller set on a farm
partialText: Jamie, Ruth's son, threatens to kill his parents if they don't give him part of the farm.

title: Patrick Swayze and Keanu Reeves star in this action thriller
partialText: An undercover cop pursuing a gang of bank robbers is seduced by the LA surf scene.

title: 'Clubs refused to look at me after my crash' - Antonio on Qatar move
partialText: Michail Antonio says he had to "swallow his ego" after a near‑fatal car crash as he joins Qatari side Al‑Sailiya.

title: F1 to revise engine rule at centre of row
partialText: Mercedes' rivals succeed in securing a rule change following a pre-season technical row over engine performance.
